msContents.summary: A Karaim translation of the Torah and the Haftarah

ab.title: Numbers 3
ab.l:
And these
are the children of Aaron and Moses in the day that the Lord spoke with Moses
on Mount Sinai.

And these are the names of the sons of Aaron:
the firstborn Nadab, and Abihu, and Eleazar, and Ithamar.

These
are the names of the sons of Aaron, the priests who were anointed, who filled
their hand to serve as priests.

And Nadab and Abihu died
before the Lord when they brought forward strange fire before the Lord
in the wilderness of Sinai, and they had no sons. And
Eleazar and Ithamar served as priests in the lifetime of Aaron their father.
And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,

‘Bring forward the tribe of Levi, and stand it before Aaron
the priest, that they may serve to him.

And
they shall keep his charge, and the charge of all the congregation
before the tent of meeting, to serve the service of the
tabernacle. The verse ‘And they shall keep’ is missing here.
And they shall keep all the vessels of the tent of meeting, and the charge of the sons of Israel, to serve the service of the tabernacle.

And you shall give the Levites to Aaron
and to his sons. They are given — they are given — to him
from the sons of Israel.

And you shall appoint Aaron and
his sons, and they shall keep their priesthood,
and the stranger that comes near to the line of their priesthood
shall be put to death.’
And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,

And I, lo, I have taken the Levites from among
the children of Israel in place of all the firstborn that opens the womb
among the children of Israel. And the Levites shall be mine.

Because all the firstborn are mine. On the day that I smote all the firstborn in the land
of Egypt I sanctified to me all the firstborn in Israel,
from human to animal. They shall be mine. I am the Lord.’

And
the Lord spoke to Moses in the wilderness of Sinai, saying,

‘Number the children of Levi by the house of their fathers, by their families.
You shall number them: every male from a month old and upward.’

And Moses numbered them according to the command of the Lord, as
he was commanded.

And these were the sons of Levi by their names:
Gershon, and Kohath, and Merari.

And these are
the names of the sons of Gershon by their families: Libni, and Shimei.
And the sons of Kohath by their families: Amram, and Izehar, and Hebron, and Uzziel.

And the sons of Merari by their families: Mahli, and Mushi. These are
the families of the Levites by the house of their fathers.

The family of Gershon are the Libnites and the family of the Shimites. These are
the families of the Gershonites.

Those numbered
of them, by the number of all the males, from a month old and upward, those numbered
of them are seven thousand and five hundred.

The families of the
Gershonites shall camp behind the tabernacle, westward.

And the prince of the house of the father of the Gershonites
is Eliasaph, son of Lael.

And the charge of the sons of Gershon
in the tent of meeting is the tabernacle, and the tent, its covering, and the cover
of the door of the ten of meeting,

And the curtains of the court,
and the covers for the door of the court which is by the tabernacle and
by the altar all around, and the cords of it according to all its service.

And the family of Kohath are the Amramites and the family of the Izeharites
and the family of the Hebronites and the family of the Uzzielites. These are they,
the families of the Kohathites.

By the number of all the males,
from a month old and upward: eight thousand and six hundred keeping
the charge of the Holy.

The families of the sons
of Kohath shall camp on the side of the tabernacle, southward.

And the prince of the house of the father of the families of the Kohathites
is Elizaphan, son of Uzziel.

And their charge
is the ark, and the table, and the lampstand, and the
altars, and the holy vessels with which they minister, and
the cover and all of its service.

And the prince of princes
of the Levites is Eleazar, son of Aaron, the priest, and has the supervision
of them that keep the charge of the Holy.

The family of Merari
are the Mahlites and the family of the Mushites. These are they, the families
of Merari.

And those numbered of them, by the number of all
the males, from a month old and upward: six thousand and two hundred.

And the prince of the house of the father of the families of Merari
is Zuriel, son of Abihail. They shall camp on the side of the tabernacle,
northward.

And the supervision of the charge of the sons
of Merari are the boards of the tabernacle, and its bars, and its pillars,
and its bases, and all its items, and all of its service,

And the pillars of the court all around, and their bases,
and their pegs, and their cords.

And
those who camp before the tabernacle, toward the rising of the sun, before
the tent of meeting, eastward, are Moses and Aaron and his sons,
keeping the charge of the sanctuary for the charge of the children of Israel.
And the stranger that comes near, other than them, shall be put to death.

All those numbered of the Levites, whom Moses and Aaron numbered
according to the commandment of the Lord, by their families, all the males from a month
old and upward: twenty-two thousand.

And the Lord said
to Moses, ‘Number all the firstborn of the males of the children of Israel
from a month old and upward, and take the sum of their names.

And you shall take the Levites for me — I am the Lord –
in place of all the firstborn among the children of Israel, and the
livestock of the Levites in place of all the firstborns among the livestock
of the children of Israel.’

And Moses numbered, as the Lord commanded
him, all the firstborn among the children of Israel.

And all the firstborn males by the number of names, from a month
old and upward, by those numbered: twenty-two thousand two hundred and
seventy-three.
And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,

‘Take the Levites instead of all the firstborn among the children
of Israel, and the livestock of the Levites instead of their livestock,
and the Levites shall be mine. I am the Lord.

And as for the redemption of the two hundred and seventy-three
who are left over the Levites from the firstborn of the children
of Israel:

You shall even take five mithqals each
per head; you shall take it by the holy mithqal. The mithqal is twenty gögs.

And you shall give the silver to Aharon
and to his sons — redemption of those left over among them.’

And Moses took the silver of the redemption
from those left over above the redemption of the Levites.

He took the silver from the firstborn of the children of Israel:
a thousand and three hundred and sixty-five mithqals, by the mithqal
of the Holy.

And Moses gave the silver of those who were redeemed
to Aaron and to his sons, according to the command of the Lord,
as the Lord commanded Moses.

app.note: Inserted by another hand in Hebrew.
K: tent of meeting; a scribal error inserted by another hand, cf. Heb. הַמִּשְכָּן ‘of the tabernacle’.
